intro: Monnina platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Monnina platyphylla is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
